summary:
I am a dedicated highly skilled Marine Electrical & Automation specialist with over 30 years’ experience both sailing and shoreside. 

I originally sailed as a Radio Officer. After that I completed my ETO training in South Shields, successfully gaining a HND in E&E Engineering and Electronic Navigation Equipment Maintenance certificate. I joined Stolt Tankers where I have been working for the past 27 years during which time I have progressed from a Trainee Electrical Engineer to Electrical & Automation Manager.

As the company grew the number of ships increased to over 100 ships the Electrical & Automation department was merged with the Maintenance & Reliability to form the Technical Asset Management (TAM) Department. I became the Senior Electric Project Manager.

My primarily responsibility is to support our fleet of 105 chemical tankers regarding electrical, communications and navigation equipment, especially our fleet of 21 Diesel Electric ships. My main areas now are sustainability projects (shore power, ESS, VFD's etc) and life extension projects.

I am responsible for:

• Managing Electrical & Automation life cycle projects. Current major projects ongoing are:
   -Shore power initiative with the Port of Rotterdam, Vopak and Stolt Tankers. https://www.stolt- 
     nielsen.com/news-insights/news/stolt-tankers-joins-feasibility-study-for-shore-based-power- 
     installation/
   - Retrofit of 4 Ships complete Integrated Control and Monitoring System (ICMS) from Valmarine XD 
      System to Hoglund Marine Automation. 2 of the ships also included an complete retrofit of the Main 
      Electric Propulsion control system from Cegelec (GE) SYCONUM to ABB Mega drive propulsion 
      control system.
   - Upgrade of SEPAM 2000 with new “SEPAM 1000 Series 80 protection relays on DE ships.
   - Retrofit of Cargo system on 4 ships – integration of latest technology into legacy system. 
   - Maintenance and selection of Navigation and Communications equipment including 
       the GMDSS communications equipment (EPIRB, SAT-C, LRIT, SSAS, Etc)
•  R&D and innovation processes related to electrical and automation activities. 
•  Identify mid- and long-term initiatives related to Energy Management projects for new and existing assets. 
- With the Engineering Applications & Connectivity Specialist we have ownership of all engineering and operational applications on managed ships related to software processes of equipment installed on the managed fleet including cyber security on the OT network and data streams from ships to shore.

profile_positions.description:
Manage Electrical & Automation projects. Provide long term vision and strategy on electrical matters. Build up network of companies that can carry out world-wide electrical services.

Main projects currently working on are the life extension of our DE ships. Sustainability initiatives including Shore Power Feasibility study for tankers with the Port of Rotterdam and Vopak.
profile_positions.title: Snr. Electrical Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Reporting to the Newbuilding and Technical General Manager with full accountability for maintaining and developing new and existing ship’s electrical standards to facilitate optimum life
Providing management and support to a team of travelling electrical superintendents and fleet electricians.
- Developing electrical specifications for new ships with the emphasis on simplifying onboard equipment to enable ease of operation, maintenance and fuel efficiency
• R&D into fuel saving by reducing the electrical power consumed onboard. 
. Managing the maintenance of the electrical system on 21 Cegelec (GE) powered diesel electric ships
•Managing ad hoc electrical or electronic projects including GMDSS, Satcom/Broadband and Voyage Data Recorder
• Assisting investigations into any accidents or incidents that may occur onboard the ships and assisting Vetting department regarding customer electrical requirements.
• Instigating the standardisation of the electrical and navigation equipment on board ships enabling a long term reduction in maintenance costs
profile_positions.title: Electrical and Automation Manager

profile_positions.description:
Working on various newbuilding projects in Denmark, Spain, Italy and Croatia with specific responsibility for the specification and installation of electrical plant and navigation equipment onboard new 37,000t, 22,000t and 5,000t diesel electric ships. Assisting the Site Electrical Inspector to ensure that electrical and electronic equipment design and quality standards comply with newbuilding specifications.Testing equipment in accordance with approved drawings, specifications and international standards and obtaining drawing approval.
After delivery I sailed with the ships for 1 contract to resolve any breakdowns that may occur.
